name: 英文寫作與研究方法（一）
goals: There are two aims of this course: (1) to conduct their own small scale research, and (2) the main aim is to get them familiarized with techniques and methods of selecting topics, developing questions, collecting and analyzing data, preparing the research paper. The ultimate goal is for the students to produce a presentable research paper.

**Course Description and Objectives:**

This two-semester seminar is designed to help MA students become better academic writers. We will develop several different skills that are necessary for academic writing at the MA level: (1) interpreting literature, or “primary sources,” through close reading; (2) interpreting academic scholarship or “secondary sources”; (3) conducting research and documenting sources; and (4) bringing together interpretations of primary and secondary sources into a well-organized academic essay. This course takes a team-based approach, with students working together with professors and peers to improve their writing through several different writing-based activities and workshops. In the first semester, students will complete several short writing assignments with the ultimate goal of writing a very short academic paper; in the second semester, students will work toward writing (or substantially revising) a complete academic essay and sharing their work in a conference presentation.

**Requirements:**

1.  Grading policy for the fall semester:   
    Attendance & participation 10%; Writing assignments 90%.  
    Two assignments of 850 words and the final assignment of 1800 words, a mini academic paper.
2.  Punctuality in turning in your homework is required. 5 points per day will be deducted (from “raw” mark out of 100) for late submissions.
3.   Any student who plagiarizes will fail the course. This includes self-plagiarism: you can _revise_ an essay/assignment that you have written for another course, but you cannot pass it off as a _new_ essay/assignment.

*   You are required to attend two workshops and have one individual consultation.
*   You are strongly encouraged to make another appointment with Robert or ask for feedback on your work via email.
